meanings.definition: A person who spoils or dampens the pleasure of others, especially during the holiday season.
meanings.sent1: The grinch at the party complained about everything.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a grinch and ruin the festive mood.
meanings.sent3: The grinch tried to steal all the presents but got caught in the act.
meanings.sent4: Her negative attitude made her the grinch of the group.
meanings.sent5: The grinch's frown could be seen from across the room.

meanings.definition: To behave in a mean-spirited or selfish manner, especially in relation to festive celebrations.
meanings.sent1: Please don't grinch the holiday spirit with your complaints.
meanings.sent2: He tends to grinch every time we plan a party.
meanings.sent3: She decided to grinch by refusing to participate in the Secret Santa exchange.
meanings.sent4: The neighbors accused him of trying to grinch their Christmas decorations.
meanings.sent5: His attempt to grinch the festivities was met with disapproval.
